what: For the best results after conversion :
title: Environment Handling
text: Avoid using framebox latex command wrap \includegraphics{} . might interfere packages ability properly read path copy relevant image properly. Try keep actual content caption without LaTeX markup (normal text), reflected HTML properly. example :
code: \begin{figure}   \includegraphics{image/sample.png}   \caption{This is a sample caption}   \labeL{fig:image-1} \end{figure}

title: Environment Handling
text: Tables commonly used RJ articles display data tabular format. However, differences way tables handled LaTeX HTML. LaTeX tables customization usually optimized printing, whereas web articles need tables optimized varying sizes media. pandoc converts tables somewhat easily, unable well table customization packages complex tables. pandoc extensions used order tackle , : simple_tables, pipe_tables Limited Multicolumn support included. example illustrates complicated table, texor package can handle subroutines pre-processing step transform LaTeX code. Stream Editor modifies \multicolumn{..} \multicolumnx{..} LaTeX macro redefines \multicolumnx{..} \multicolumn{---}, accepted pandoc. Finally pandoc reads table transforms markdown. Also note stream editor used rename table* environment table environment markdown/HTML support specific changes table* environment bring. Resulting Markdown Generated look like :
code: \begin{table*}[t!] \begin{center} \begin{tabular}{l | llll }  \hline  \multicolumn{1}{c |}{EXAMPLE} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{$X$} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{$Y$} \\  \hline   & 1 & 2 & 1 & 2 \\  EX1  & X11 & X12 &  Y11  & Y12 \\  EX2  & X21 & X22 &  Y21  & Y22 \\  EX3  & X31 & X32 &  Y31  & Y32 \\  EX4  & X41 & X42 &  Y41  & Y42\\  EX5  & X51 & X52 &  Y51  & Y52 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \label{table1} \caption{An Example Table with Multicolumn} \end{center} \end{table*} ::: center ::: {#table1}   -------------------------------------   EXAMPLE   \(X\)         \(Y\)      --------- ------- ----- ------- -----             1       2     1       2    EX1       X11     X12   Y11     Y12    EX2       X21     X22   Y21     Y22    EX3       X31     X32   Y31     Y32    EX4       X41     X42   Y41     Y42    EX5       X51     X52   Y51     Y52   -------------------------------------    : Table 1: An Example Table with Multicolumn :::  []{#table1 label="table1"} :::

what: Converting LaTeX R Journal Articles into RJ-web-articles

text: texor package deals multiple challenges occour conversion LaTeX source files (typically generate PDF) web friendly RJ-web-article format.

what: Currently texor can handle R-Journal structured LaTeX files with support for:
title: Converting LaTeX R Journal Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: RJournal based LaTeX files macros \pkg{},\CRANpkg{},\BIOpkg{}, \code{}, \acronym{} Reading Metadata LaTeX file well DESCRIPTION. Reading bibliography bibtex files ignoring \thebibliography Supports code environments like Sinput,Soutput, example ,example*,verbatim, smallverbatim code highlight. Supports graphics included PDF, PNG, JPG, tikz, algorithm2e graphics supported (figures might work). Functions convert PDF graphics PNG. Almost tables supported exceptions. things like citations,links,footnotes,math,CTV,package references also supported. Bibliography management aggregation.(moved rebib) Figure/Table/Equation numbering Stream Editor rename alien commands/environments accepted defaults. Pre Post conversion statistics environments verification. Support included files (1 degree related main article ). Logging events.

title: Converting LaTeX R Journal Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: Install Pandoc v3.1 greater, ideally latest version. using Rstudio, pre-installed. included PDF conversions also install poppler-utils (used pdftools package) Ideally install latest version poppler-utils. Install mainline version CRAN : Install development version GitHub :
code: # To check the version of pandoc rmarkdown::pandoc_version() # or to simply check if you are good to go in terms of pandoc texor::pandoc_version_check() # TRUE if pandoc is good to go # FALSE if pandoc is too old for texor install.packages('texor') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Abhi-1U/texor") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Abhi-1U/texor")

title: Converting LaTeX R Journal Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: quick example use texor package sample RJournal article (included package inst/article)
code: # for a single LaTeX article  texor::latex_to_web(article_dir) # A running example article_dir <- system.file("examples/article", package = "texor") dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "tempdir")) x <- file.copy(from = article_dir, to = your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE,) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"article",sep="/") # view your original article at your_article_path texor::latex_to_web(your_article_path,log_steps = FALSE, example = TRUE) # view  your converted and original article at paste0(your_article_path,"/web")

title: Converting LaTeX R Journal Articles into RJ-web-articles
code: # for multiple articles in RJ folder structure #base dir  article_dir <- "C:/Users/abhis/path/to/base" # list of journal number directories journal_dirs <- list.dirs(article_dir,recursive = FALSE) # list of individual slug directories slug_dirs <- lapply(journal_dirs,function(journal_dir) {     list.dirs(journal_dir,recursive = FALSE) }) # creating a single list of all slug directories slug_dirs <- unlist(slug_dirs) # Calling  for (dir in slug_dirs) {     #print(dir)     getwd()     # below function will create a log file of success/error in current     # working directory while running the texor::latex_to_web() function     texor:::convert_to_html(dir) }

title: Version 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-27

title: Version 1.3.0
text: Equations better handled equation references edited match bookdown format. Knitting Rmarkdown now done outside temp folder avoid PDF compilation errors. Added workaround macros \nameref{} \autoref{}. Added workaround macros \scalebox{}, \fbox{}, \adjustbox{}, \framebox{}. Option set DPI invoking convert_to_png function.

title: Version 1.3.0
text: CodeBlocks WideTables now back original form. Algorithm get separate numbering references. Removed unnecessary warnings. Better mechanism remove leftover text processing tikz. Package names using \pkg{} now bold. Reduced DPI raster images reduce file sizes. Algorithmic treated figures. Fixes lua filters equation now adds basic support tabular removes nested inline math. Fixing logic table reference numbering.

title: Version 1.3.0
text: images processed set default alt-text : ‘graphic without alt text’

title: Version 1.2.0
text: CodeBlock WideTable get numbering (share references figures), Enhancement #51. added support \command{..} macro. Included dummy slug citation_url, Issue #50. Included constructor sample article, Enhancement #52. Added support \file{},\var{},\env{},\option{},\dfn{}, \cpkg{} \samp{} macro. Asking user Inputs interactive_mode, Enhancement #53.

title: Version 1.2.0
text: Modified workflow avoid missing Images. Modified Lua filters suppress numbering widetables captions. Fixed Issue #49 text algorithms left behind. Updated pdf conversion functions poppler version check note man pages. Fixed copying markdown files back temp_mode.
